title: Radiological Oncology Anatomy Education: Interdisciplinary Interactive Learning Module

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Limited-use environment for anatomy labs and digital image analysis tools. Utilizes smartphone-based resource sharing and collaboration tools

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify and explain the 3D structures of four anatomical regions (head/neck, thorax, abdomen/pelvis, musculoskeletal system) related to radiation oncology.
Learners can contour radiation-targeted structures with 90% accuracy by linking CT/MRI images with anatomical specimens.
Learners can collaborate with an interdisciplinary team (radiation oncology, radiology, anatomists) to assess anatomical risk levels for clinical cases.

resources: Multidisciplinary Instructor Pool (Radiation Oncologists, Radiologic Technologists, Anatomists)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
